oai_dc:dc.dc:title: COMPARATIVE ANALYSIS OF ALTERNATIVE LAYOUTS FOR THE NEW DEEPWATER BREAKWATER OF GENOA PORT
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Girolamo, Paolo De
Franco, Leopoldo
Noli, Alberto
Scotti, Alberto
Lizzadro, Antonio
Tartaglini, Marco
Bianco, Marco del
Sammarco, Paolo
Contini, Paolo
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A new deepwater breakwater for the Port of Genoa, which is the largest Italian port, has been recently designed and construction started in 2023. The goal of the new vertically composite breakwater which reaches 50 m of depth, is to allow access to the new generation container ships (23.000 TEU; length overall 400 m; breath 61,5 m; draught 14,5 m). Basically, two alternative plan layouts have been selected for the new breakwater. The purpose of the paper is to illustrate the alternative solutions identified for the breakwater and to present the corresponding comparative analysis and the final choice.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Coastal Engineering Proceedings; No. 38 (2024): Proceedings of 38th Conference on Coastal Engineering, Rome, Italy, 2024; papers.40
